Topic: Draw a fish in their habitat with labels.
Level Description: Proficient (shows most elements clearly and correctly)
CAN: The student can draw a fish and label it correctly in its water habitat.
The student can include and label significant details like some plants and other animals that live with the fish in the water.
The student can identify and label key resources in the fish's habitat, such as water and some plants.
The student can show and label simple interactions, such as the fish swimming in water.
The student can illustrate and label some parts of the habitat that help the fish survive.
CANNOT: The student may inconsistently show or label the interdependencies within the habitat, missing complex interactions or relationships.
The student may not fully use the drawing to explain how the fish and its habitat are part of a broader system working together (may not articulate clearly how resources are interconnected).
